verses.verse: Beth Peor, (Deut. 3:17; Josh. 12:3) the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimothâ€”

(Deut. 3:10) all the cities of the plain and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, (Num. 21:24) whom Moses had struck (Num. 31:8) with the princes of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were princes of Sihon dwelling in the country.
The children of Israel also killed with the sword (Num. 22:5; 31:8) Balaam the son of Beor, the soothsayer, among those who were killed by them.
And the border of the children of Reuben was the bank of the Jordan. This was the inheritance of the children of Reuben according to their families, the cities and their villages.
(The Land of Gad) (Num. 34:14; 1 Chr. 5:11) Moses also had given an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad according to their families.
(Num. 32:1, 35) Their territory was Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, (Judg. 11:13, 15) and half the land of the Ammonites as far as Aroer, which is before (Deut. 3:11; 2 Sam. 11:1; 12:26) Rabbah,
and from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpah and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir,

and in the valley (Num. 32:36) Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, (Gen. 33:17; 1 Kin. 7:46) Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan as its border, as far as the edge (Num. 34:11; Deut. 3:17) of the Sea of Chinnereth, on the other side of the Jordan eastward.
This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities and their villages.

(Half the Tribe of Manasseh (East)) (Num. 34:14; 1 Chr. 5:23) Moses also had given an inheritance to half the tribe of Manasseh; it was for half the tribe of the children of Manasseh according to their families:
Their territory was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and (Num. 32:41; 1 Chr. 2:23) all the towns of Jair which are in Bashan, sixty cities;

half of Gilead, and (Josh. 9:10; 12:4; 13:12; 1 Chr. 6:71) Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the (Num. 32:39, 40; Josh. 17:1) children of Machir the son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Machir according to their families.
These are the areas which Moses had distributed as an inheritance in the plains of Moab on the other side of the Jordan, by Jericho eastward.
(Deut. 18:1; Josh. 13:14; 18:7) But to the tribe of Levi Moses had given no inheritance; the LORD God of Israel was their inheritance, (Num. 18:20; Deut. 10:9; 18:1, 2) as He had said to them.

(The Land Divided West of the Jordan) These are the areas which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, (Num. 34:16-29) which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel distributed as an inheritance to them.
